app.title: Who's a Wolf ?
app.intro:
You've been sent to gather statements from the last villagers of Howlmore Town after a string of werewolf attacks. One or more are lying because they are secretly werewolves. One other villager, you were told, is a shill paid by the werewolves to lie.

Can you find who's a werewolf, who's an honest villager, and who is the lying shill?

errors.noWerewolf: We know that at least one of villager is a werewolf. Click on the characters to change your suspicions.
errors.noShill: We know that one villager must be a shill.
errors.tooManyShills: We know that exactly one villager must bea shill.
errors.werewolfNotLying: You suspect {name} of being a werewolf, yet according to your other suspicions, they are not lying.
errors.shillNotLying: You suspect {name} of being a shill, yet according to your other suspicions, they are not lying.
errors.truthfulLying: You marked {name} as truthful, yet their statement disagrees with the rest of your suspicions.

statements.ifAThenB: {bName} has always been under {aName}'s spell. If {aName} is a werewolf, then so is {bName}.
statements.bothOrNeither: {aName} and {bName} are inseparable. Either both are wolves, or neither is.
statements.atLeastOne: At least one of {aName} and {bName} is a wolf: my Timmy was going to meet them the night he was eaten.
statements.exactlyOne: {aName} and {bName} hate each other so ferociously, it is clear one is a wolf and the other isn't.
statements.atMostOne: {aName} and {bName} are so unalike! Clearly they couldn't both be wolves.
statements.ifNotAThenB: I have seen {bName} creeping on {aName} once. If {aName} is not a wolf, then {bName} is a wolf.
statements.neither: I know {aName} and {bName} very well, and neither of them is a wolf.

exactly.singular: I counted the pawprints! There is exactly 1 wolf among my neighbors.
exactly.plural: I counted the pawprints! There are exactly {count} wolves among my neighbors.

atMost.singular: I've seen the wolves, and there is at most 1 of them.
atMost.plural: I've seen the wolves, and there are at most {count} of them.

atLeast.singular: I looked at the bite marks. There is at least 1 wolf among my neighbors.
atLeast.plural: I looked at the bite marks. There are at least {count} wolves among my neighbors.

countWerewolves.even: The pawprints show these beasts go by pair. There's an even number of wolves among my neighbors.
countWerewolves.odd: Wolves hunt by pair but I saw a lone one! There's an odd number of wolves among my neighbors.
